¶357 Prinsengracht
Tuesday ii o'clock a.m.

Dr Verwey.

Some days ago, I got a letter from dr. Speyer informing me that the hours for the Latin Course in question were to be from 2'oclock till 4 in the afternoon, so that I cannot possibly join his lections which I greatly regret of course. -
    As I should like however to carry out my intention, to learn the principals of said language you would oblige me, by telling me which grammar books you think best for getting a good store of latin roots, inflexions, & conjugations in my head, which is of course of immense use for me in tracing the origin of English words from the Romance stock. -
   
If you will be kind enough in assisting me in some way, I shall feel obliged,
Believe me
Yours truly
J.P.M. Dietz

I'll wait for you to-morrow morning till nine

Dr Speyer wrote me if I intended to attend his courses, I wanted the following books:
dr. Speyer, Lat. Spraakkunst 1o deel 2e dr. 1883, Brill Leiden
Cornelius Nepos, ed. Cobet 1881 Brill Leiden
What is your opinion as to above books?
